alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WARREN AND WESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Morrow, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Blanchester, New Vienna, Morrow, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Midland, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Middleboro, Oakland, Cuba, State Route 350 at US Route 22, Morrisville, Ogden, Kingman, Burtonville and Cowan Lake State Park. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 39 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
